org.dotplot.tokenizer.filter
Class LineFilter

java.lang.Object
  org.dotplot.tokenizer.filter.BaseTokenFilter
      org.dotplot.tokenizer.filter.LineFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<ITokenFilter>, ITokenFilter, ITokenStream
public class LineFilter
extends BaseTokenFilter

This Filter collects Token from a Line returns them as one Token.

Version:
1.0 12.5.04
Author:
Christian Gerhardt

Method Detail

init

private void init()

filterToken

public Token filterToken(Token token)
Filters Token.

All normal Token will be buffered until an EOLToken will be recognized. After that, the buffered Token will be put together and will be seen as only one Token wich represents a whole line. All LineToken will be divided in it's amount through a blank space

Specified by:
filterToken in interface ITokenFilter
Specified by:
filterToken in class BaseTokenFilter
Parameters:
token - - the Token which should be filtered
Returns:
-the Token, if it wasn't been filtered or NULL
See Also:
ITokenFilter.filterToken(org.dotplot.tokenizer.Token)

dontReturnEmptyLines

public void dontReturnEmptyLines()
Disables the returning of empty lines. If twoEOLToken follow after another, it's a sign that this is a empty line. With this, a return of the LineToken will be closed down which are empty lines

doReturnEmptyLines

public void doReturnEmptyLines()
Enbables the returning of empty lines. If twoEOLToken follow after another, it's a sign that this is a empty line.

isReturningEmptyLines

public boolean isReturningEmptyLines()
Proves if empty lines will be returned through the Filter.

Returns:
- The result
